intro: Anthonotha leptorrhachis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed anthonotha, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the daisy or sunflower family. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often with a slightly hairy surface. Anthonotha leptorrhachis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
